name: Spaghetti
description: A long, thin, solid, cylindrical noodle pasta. It is typically made from durum wheat semolina. Most famous for co-starring in spaghetti and meatballs.
imageCredit: Photo by Christine Sandu on Unsplash

name: Fusilli
description: A variety of pasta that is formed into corkscrew or helical shape. Traditionally formed by rolling a small rod over strips of pasta to wind them into their final shape.
imageCredit: By Luigi Chiesa - Own work, CC BY-SA 3.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=3663706

name: Macaroni
description: A narrow, tube-shaped pasta commonly exhibiting a curved shape. A classic part of mac n' cheese.

name: Tortellini
description: Ring-shaped pasta, commonly stuffed with meat or cheese.
imageCredit: Angelo.Muratore, CC BY-SA 4.0 https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0, via Wikimedia Commons

name: Lasagna
description: A wide, flat pasta typically used in the Italian dish also known as Lasagna, which is prepared by stacking alternating layers of pasta with a rag√∫ meat sauce and cheese.
imageCredit: Angelo.Muratore, CC BY-SA 4.0 https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0, via Wikimedia Commons

name: Cavatappi
description: Meaning "corkscrews" in Italian, this is a ridged tube-shaped pasta, extruded into a helix shape. Its ridges make it an excellent choice for holding rich sauces.
imageCredit: By Popo le Chien - Own work, CC0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=74630674

name: Radiatori
description: A short, corkscew-shaped pasta with ruffled edges. Its name means "radiator" in Italian, due to its similar resemblance. Its many hollow ridges make it an excellent pick for holding rich sauces.
imageCredit: By Popo le Chien - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=58804936

name: Stelle
description: A very small, star-shaped pasta. Considered a "pastina", or literally "little pasta" in Italian. Usually used within broth-based dishes.
imageCredit: By Popo le Chien - Own work, CC0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=74630595

name: Gnocchi
description: A short, dense pasta resembling a dumpling. Heavily varying by region, this pasta can be made with ricotta, potato, or even polenta. It is always cooked from a fresh or frozen state.
imageCredit: By Paoletta S. - originally posted to Flickr as Gnocchi di ricotta burro e salvia, CC BY 2.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=4245468

name: Fettuccine
description: A long, flat-shaped pasta. This pasta has a medium width and it most famous in the classic dish, Fettuccine Alfredo. Its name means "little ribbons" in Italian.
imageCredit: By Popo le Chien - Own work, CC0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=71882393
